Author: jl777c#5810
Content: very easy to get into a deadlock with all the semaphores being locked at higher levels

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the threshold should be a dynamic one. unless it is just set to the max possible bets per block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it is set to 100, and there are 200 bets wanting to be made each block, half of them will fail

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so block.tx.size() + 100 would be a good blocknotify threshold

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: B. G√ºltekin √áetiner#0626
Content: Kmdice seems to be a good tool to test the performance and illustrate the scalibity of Komodo blokchain. I wonder if it works as a zero-sum game or not. As far as I understand, people bet against the fund having half of total supply as premined coins. When betting, do people lose their bet into that fund? If so, it will be like a lottery game which means a zero-sum game. Or is it one side where people do not lose their bet. In that case it would be somehow draining all the funds in premined address in some period of time. Which one is the case?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: CCDuration is just returning "no hashBlock" however a getrawtransaction call on komodo-cli for that tx returns that the tx does not exist... I am fixing it prety sure I know what I did wrong.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dice is a zero sum game against the dealer/house

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: lost bets go into the fund

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: wins come out of the fund

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the realtime nature of bet resolution makes it quite addictive
